channel.title: KDnuggets
channel.description: Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, Analytics, AI

item.title: Dr. Data Show Video: How Can You Trust AI?
item.dc:creator: Eric Siegel
item.description: This new web series breaks the mold for data science infotainment, captivating the planet with short webisodes that cover the very best of machine learning and predictive analytics.

item.title: Start your journey into data science today
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Springboard’s Introduction to Data Science Course will help you build a strong foundation in R programming, communicate effectively by telling a story with data, clean and analyze large datasets, and more. Apply before Oct 22 and use code KDNUGGETSOCT500 for $500 Data Science Career Track.

item.title: Will Models Rule the World? Data Science Salon Miami, Nov 6-7
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: This post is excerpted from the thoughts of Data Science Salon Miami speakers on the future of model-based decision-making.

item.title: Holy Grail of AI for Enterprise — Explainable AI
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Explainable AI (XAI) is an emerging branch of AI where AI systems are made to explain the reasoning behind every decision made by them. We investigate some of its key benefits and design principles.

item.title: The Intuitions Behind Bayesian Optimization with Gaussian Processes
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Bayesian Optimization adds a Bayesian methodology to the iterative optimizer paradigm by incorporating a prior model on the space of possible target functions. This article introduces the basic concepts and intuitions behind Bayesian Optimization with Gaussian Processes.

item.title: McKinsey Datathon: The City Cup17 November, Amsterdam, Stockholm and Zurich. Apply Now
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: While solving the challenge, you will gain insights into the types of problems that McKinsey Data Scientists solve daily to help their clients. Top prize is 5K Euro + conference attendance of your choice.

item.title: How to Solve the ModelOps Challenge
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: A recent study shows that while 85% believe data science will allow their companies to obtain or sustain a competitive advantage, only 5% are using data science extensively. Join this webinar, Nov 14, to find out why.

item.title: BI to AI: Getting Intelligent Insights to Everyone
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Tellius is a Search and AI-Powered Analytics Platform that makes it easy for users to ask questions of their business data and discover insights using machine learning, with just a single click.

item.title: Apache Spark Introduction for Beginners
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: An extensive introduction to Apache Spark, including a look at the evolution of the product, use cases, architecture, ecosystem components, core concepts and more.

item.title: New Jobs Sure to Emerge Alongside Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: There’s a lot of doomsaying about AI pushing humans out of jobs and destroying entire industries. Is it as bad as all that? Maybe not!

item.title: Graphs Are The Next Frontier In Data Science
item.dc:creator: Reshama Shaikh
item.description: GraphConnect 2018, Neo4j’s bi-annual conference, was held in New York City in mid-September. Read about what happened, and why graphs are the next big thing in data science.

item.title: Top KDnuggets tweets, Oct 10-16: 7 Books to Grasp Mathematical Foundations of Data Science and Machine Learning; 6 Books Every Data Scientist Should Keep Nearby
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: Also Machine Learning Cheat Sheets; Top 8 Free Must-Read Books on Deep Learning.

item.title: Citizen Data Scientists | Why Not DIY AI?
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: This live debate will feature AutoML advocate Gene Ferruzza (Valassis Digital), countered by Gregory Piatetsky-Shapiro (KDnuggets) who asks if you would really fly with a citizen pilot. Fasten your seatbelts and register now - seats are limited!

item.title: University of San Francisco: Assistant Professor, Tenure Track, Mathematics and Statistics [San Francisco, CA]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: The University of San Francisco invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant Professor position to begin August 2019. We seek well-qualified candidates in the areas of applied mathematics or statistics, with a focus on the extraction of knowledge from data.

item.title: Mindstrong Health: Sr Data Scientist / Machine Learning, Statistics, Coding [Palo Alto, CA]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Mindstrong Health is seeking a Sr Data Scientist in Palo Alto, CA, who is passionate about our mission, committed to excellence and excited to build a company that will address one of the greatest health challenges of our time.

item.title: The Definitive Guide to AI’s “Black Box” Problem
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: The Amazing, Anti-Jargon, Insight Filled, and Totally Free Handbook to Integrating AI in Highly Regulated Industries - get it now.

item.title: Music for Data Scientists? Music by Data Scientists? …What…?!
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Introducing Mean Reversion, an NYC-based songwriting duo comprising of data scientist Foster Provost and statistician Cliff Hurvich.

item.title: The Main Approaches to Natural Language Processing Tasks
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mayo
item.description: Let's have a look at the main approaches to NLP tasks that we have at our disposal. We will then have a look at the concrete NLP tasks we can tackle with said approaches.

item.title: KDnuggets™ News 18:n39, Oct 17: 10 Best Mobile Apps for Data Scientist; Vote in new poll: Largest dataset you analyzed?
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: Also: An interesting explanation of why Adversarial examples arise; 5 clean code tips to improve your productivity; Github Python Data Science; and don't forget to vote in new poll: What was the largest dataset you analyzed?

item.title: [Webinar] Neural Network Fundamentals
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: In this webinar, Oct 25, 2018, 10:00 am PST, we will apply your convolutional neural network using the ImageNet scenario. We will also review some of the ImageNet architectures and how convolutions work.

item.title: Accelerating Your Algorithms in Production [Webinar Replay]
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Numerical algorithms are computationally demanding, which makes performance an important consideration when using Python for machine learning, especially as you move from desktop to production.

item.title: Adversarial Examples, Explained
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Deep neural networks—the kind of machine learning models that have recently led to dramatic performance improvements in a wide range of applications—are vulnerable to tiny perturbations of their inputs. We investigate how to deal with these vulnerabilities.

item.title: Applied Data Science: Solving a Predictive Maintenance Business Problem Part 3
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: In this post we will expand our analysis to multiple variables and then see how intuitions we develop during the exploration phase, can lead to generating new features for modelling.

item.title: GitHub Python Data Science Spotlight: High Level Machine Learning & NLP, Ensembles, Command Line Viz & Docker Made Easy
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mayo
item.description: This post spotlights 5 data science projects, all of which are open source and are present on GitHub repositories, focusing on high level machine learning libraries and low level support tools.

item.title: University of San Francisco: Postdoctoral Fellowship, Data Institute [San Francisco, CA]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: University of San Francisco invites applications for a postdoctoral position starting in August 2019.

item.title: Bring Essential Data Governance Training to Your Team
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Technology trends such as big data, cloud, self-service, and agile challenge traditional data governance practices. TDWI Onsite Education sends top-rated instructors to teach the skills you need at your location. Discounts available for training scheduled prior to Dec 31, 2018.

item.title: DATAx Guide to Data Visualization in 2019
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: Get DATAx Guide to Data Visualization in 2019, the definitive foundation to help you prepare for the future of data visualization, AI and machine learning. Also use KD200 to get extra $200 off DATAx New York early bird pricing until Oct 19.

item.title: Choose Your Own Adventure – Analytics On-boarding
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Lower the barriers to productivity by employing a “Choose your own adventure” approach to on-boarding your new analytics team members.

item.title: Top Stories, Oct 8-14: 10 Best Mobile Apps for Data Scientist / Data Analysts; BIG, small or Right Data: Which is the proper focus?
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Also: How To Learn Data Science If You’re Broke; Top 8 Python Machine Learning Libraries; 9 Must-have skills you need to become a Data Scientist, updated; SQL, Python, & R: All in One Platform; Using Confusion Matrices to Quantify the Cost of Being Wrong

item.title: 5 “Clean Code” Tips That Will Dramatically Improve Your Productivity
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: TL;DR: If it isn’t tested, it’s broken; Choose meaningful names; Classes and functions should be small and obey the Single Responsibility Principle (SRP); Catch and handle exceptions, even if you don’t think you need to; Logs, logs, logs

item.title: Learn the top things to look for in an AI Vendor
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: In this webinar, Oct 25, find out why it's so hard to choose an AI vendor and show you what to consider as you seek a partner in AI. Additionally, get the details of how successfully implemented AI technologies at Wellen have transformed the way the company does business.

item.title: Machine learning — Is the emperor wearing clothes?
item.dc:creator: Cassie Kozyrkov
item.description: We take a look at the core concepts of Machine Learning, including the data, algorithm and optimization needed to get you started, with links to additional resources to help enhance your knowledge.

item.title: New Poll: What was the largest dataset you analyzed / data mined?
item.dc:creator: Gregory Piatetsky
item.description: New KDnuggets Poll is asking: What was the largest dataset you analyzed / data mined? Please vote and we will analyze the trends and publish the results.

item.title: We Sized Washington’s Edible Marijuana Market Using AI
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: As Canada legalizes marijuana, it might look to Washington to understand how pot sells. With the RAND Corp., we used machine learning to estimate how much THC- in pot is sold in Washington.

item.title: Join us for DataTech19, Scotland’s first technical data science conference as part of DataFest
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: DataTech19 will take place on 14th March in Edinburgh, at the National Museum of Scotland, bringing together analysts, developers, engineers and scientists from the public sector, academia and industry for technical presentations and discussions of important topics in data science.

item.title: Temple University: Faculty Positions (Assistant/Associate/Full Professor) [Philadelphia, PA]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: The Department of Computer and Information Sciences (CIS) at Temple University invites applications for multiple tenure-track faculty positions. Exceptional candidates at all ranks and areas of will be considered. Successful candidates will join world-class investigators.

item.title: SQL, Python, & R: All in One Platform
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Mode Studio connects a SQL editor, Python and R notebooks, and a visualization builder in one platform. Sign up now for access.

item.title: DataCamp: Part-time Contract Instructors [Remote]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: DataCamp is seeking a Part-time Contract Instructors to work remotely. Share your knowledge with over 2,770,000 data scientists around the world, and associate your name with the things you teach and cool stuff you’ve built.

item.title: Machine Reading Comprehension: Learning to Ask & Answer
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Investigating the dual ask-answer network, covering the embedding, encoding, attention and output layer, as well as the loss function, with code examples to help you get started.

item.title: Using Confusion Matrices to Quantify the Cost of Being Wrong
item.dc:creator: William Schmarzo
item.description: The terms ‘true condition’ (‘positive outcome’) and ‘predicted condition’ (‘negative outcome’) are used when discussing Confusion Matrices. This means that you need to understand the differences (and eventually the costs associated) with Type I and Type II Errors.

item.title: Evaluating the Business Value of Predictive Models in Python and R
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: In these blogs for R and python we explain four valuable evaluation plots to assess the business value of a predictive model. We show how you can easily create these plots and help you to explain your predictive model to non-techies.

item.title: Top KDnuggets tweets, Oct 3–9: 5 Reasons Logistic Regression should be the first thing you learn when becoming a Data Scientist
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Also: Cheat sheet: Deep learning losses & optimizers; Journey to Machine Learning – 100 Days of ML Code; Math for Machine Learning; Essential Math for Data Science: ‘Why’ and ‘How’

item.title: TDWI In-Person and Virtual Data and Analytics Training
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: TDWI education is designed to bring you from foundational concepts and best practices to hands-on skills and ideation so you can ultimately put your knowledge to work back in the office, immediately. Save 20% when you register for one of our 2018 Seminars through October 19. Use Code KD20.

item.title: Data Mining Book: Chapter Download.
item.dc:creator: Gregory PS Editor
item.description: Download this immediately useful book chapter, and learn how to create derived variables, which allow the statistical and Data Science modeling to incorporate human insights.

item.title: Top September Stories: Essential Math for Data Science: Why and How; Machine Learning Cheat Sheets
item.dc:creator: Gregory Piatetsky
item.description: Also: Journey to Machine Learning - 100 Days of ML Code; How many data scientists are there and is there a shortage?

item.title: a4 Media: Manager, Machine Learning Data Engineer [Long Island City, NY]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: a4 Media is seeking a Manager, Machine Learning Data Engineer in Long Island City, NY, focused on managing the business understanding, data acquisition, and data understanding phases of an agile CRISP-data science process.

item.title: 10 Best Mobile Apps for Data Scientist / Data Analysts
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: A collection of useful mobile applications that will help enhance your vital data science and analytic skills. These free apps can improve your listening abilities, logical skills, basic leadership qualities and more.

item.title: Preprocessing for Deep Learning: From covariance matrix to image whitening
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: The goal of this post/notebook is to go from the basics of data preprocessing to modern techniques used in deep learning. My point is that we can use code (Python/Numpy etc.) to better understand abstract mathematical notions!

item.title: KDnuggets™ News 18:n38, Oct 10: Concise Explanation of Learning Algorithms; Why I Call Myself a Data Scientist; Linear Regression in the Wild
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: This week, KDnuggets brings you a discussion of learning algorithms with a hat tip to Tom Mitchell, discusses why you might call yourself a data scientist, explores machine learning in the wild, checks out some top trends in deep learning, shows you how to learn data science if you are low on finances, and puts forth one person's opinion on the top 8 Python machine learning libraries to help get the job done.

item.title: New Online MS in Business Analytics from Drexel
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: With Drexel University’s online MS in Business Analytics program, you’ll be able to effectively analyze this data to give your company and yourself a competitive edge.

item.title: TEXATA Data Analytics Summit 2018 – Exclusive 30% KDnuggets Discount.
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: The 4th Annual TEXATA Summit is only 2 weeks away! Join us on Friday October 19th in Austin, Texas to learn and connect with your fellow Industry Leaders.

item.title: Top 8 Python Machine Learning Libraries
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: Part 1 of a new series investigating the top Python Libraries across Machine Learning, AI, Deep Learning and Data Science.

item.title: How To Learn Data Science If You’re Broke
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: A first-hand account on how to learn data science on a budget, with advice covering useful resources, a recommended curriculum, typical concepts, building a portfolio and more.

item.title: Semantic Interoperability: Are you training your AI by mixing data sources that look the same but aren’t?
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Semantic interoperability is a challenge in AI systems, especially since data has become increasingly more complex. The other issue is that semantic interoperability may be compromised when people use the same system differently.

item.title: Building an Image Classifier Running on Raspberry Pi
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Gad
item.description: The tutorial starts by building the Physical network connecting Raspberry Pi to the PC via a router. After preparing their IPv4 addresses, SSH session is created for remotely accessing of the Raspberry Pi. After uploading the classification project using FTP, clients can access it using web browsers for classifying images.

item.title: Big career opportunities in big data
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Are you ready to take on a leadership role in your career? Prepare yourself with a Master's Degree in Data Analytics offered online through Penn State World Campus. Applications for spring 2019 are due Thursday, November 15.

item.title: BIG, small or Right Data: Which is the proper focus?
item.dc:creator: Dan Clark
item.description: For most businesses, having and using big data is either impossible, impractical, costly to justify, or difficult to outsource due to the over demand of qualified resources. So, what are the benefits of using small data?

item.title: Top Stories, Oct 1-7: Machine Learning Cheat Sheets; How to Create a Simple Neural Network in Python
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Also: Recent Advances for a Better Understanding of Deep Learning; Basic Image Data Analysis Using Python – Part 4; A Concise Explanation of Learning Algorithms with the Mitchell Paradigm; Essential Math for Data Science: Why and How

item.title: Things you should know when traveling via the Big Data Engineering hype-train
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Maybe you want to join the Big Data world? Or maybe you are already there and want to validate your knowledge? Or maybe you just want to know what Big Data Engineers do and what skills they use? If so, you may find the following article quite useful.

item.title: Colorado State University: Assistant Professor in Industrial and Organizational (IO) Psychology [Fort Collins, CO]
item.dc:creator: Matt Mayo Editor
item.description: Colorado State University is seeking a Assistant Professor in Industrial and Organizational (IO) Psychology in Fort Collins, CO. Priority will be given to candidates with research expertise in Data Science and IO. Data Science is considered a multidisciplinary/interdisciplinary field that connects business, statistics, computer science and/or software programming, behavioral sciences, and communication.
